meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - The season's grooviest gaming commentator here! Let me tell you, this week we've got a real treat for you - Yars Rising, an action-packed platformer that's got everyone buzzing!

I mean, GameGrin's scored it a solid 90, calling it "an awesome mix of 2D action and stealth with retro game action in one". That's some serious praise right there! Gamers Heroes agrees, saying it's "truly immersive" with elements from the best MetroidVanias and anime series. And hey, it gets that "must-play" vibe going!

Now, I know what you're thinking - what about the other critics? Well, Digital Trends gives Yars Rising a score of 70, saying it takes an Atari classic into the future with "ingenious results". Hardcore Gamer also scores it 70, but with a more mixed bag - they found the controls to be fluid and smooth, but the game lacks real challenge. Hm, interesting! Maybe this Emi chick is all flash and no substance? Nah, I think she's got some skills!

Multiplayer.it doesn't seem too thrilled, with a score of 60 - not exactly a ringing endorsement! But hey, God is a Geek at least gives Yars Rising some credit, saying it's "decent enough", even if it's an odd way to revive the Atari franchise. Slant Magazine's got the lowest score with 50, calling it simply "frustratingly familiar" - yikes!

So, what's the takeaway here? Well, let me put it this way - Yars Rising may not be perfect, but it's definitely a fun ride! With its innovative gameplay and snazzy graphics, you'll be hooked from start to finish. And hey, even if some critics didn't exactly love it, that just means there's more for fans like us to enjoy!

Stay groovy out there, folks - Hippo Penny signing off!
